analytic.title: TO THE MOST LEAR∣NED AND COMPLEAT Gentleman William Redman of great Shelsord in the Countie of Cam∣bridge Esquire.

monogr.title: Great Brittaines generall ioyes. Londons glorious triumphes : Dedicated to the immortall memorie of the ioyfull mariage of the two famous and illustrious princes, Fredericke and Elizabeth. Celebrated the 14. of Februarie, being S. Valentines day. With the instalment of the sayd potent Prince Fredericke at Windsore, the 7. of Februarie aforesaid
monogr.author: Nixon, Anthony

div.head: TO THE MOST LEARNED AND COMPLEAT Gentleman William Redman of great Shelsord in the Countie of Cambridge Esquire.

lg.l: I Not respect the pride of common prayse,
Nor the disdaine of Fooles, abusing kind;
Rude Ignorance her thoughts could neuer raise
To iudge of Wisedome, or to know the Minde:
My heart in this, shall euer be precise,
To wish the loue of few, so they be wise:
Thus to the wight, whose thoughts are still deuine,
In whom a worthy honour'd heart doth raigne:
Where Wisedome in her best attire doth shine,
And all the vertues, voyde of all disdaine:
To such am I transferd, my Muse doth vow
To honour such a wight; and such are you.

closer.signed: By the true honorer of your learning and vertue, A.N.
